channel.title: Shahrooz Aghili
channel.description: This is where I share my cloud native learnings ;) stay tuned!

videos.title: Build Your OWN MCP Server for Kubernetes | AI Integration Crash Course
videos.description:
Model Context Protocol (MCP) is revolutionizing how AI applications integrate with external systems and data sources. In this comprehensive tutorial, you'll learn how to build
  production-ready MCP servers and create a Kubernetes operator to manage them at scale.

  MCP provides a standardized way for LLMs to access context from your systems - think of it as "USB for AI integrations". Instead of building M√óN integrations between AI apps and
  tools, MCP transforms it into an M+N problem with a unified protocol.

  #kubernetes #mcp #operator #ai #llm #cloudnative #platformengineering #kubebuilder #programming

  ‚û° GitHub: https://github.com/aghilish/k8s-mcp
  ‚û° Follow me on GitHub: https://github.com/aghilish
  ‚û° Follow me on LinkedIn: https://linkedin.com/in/aghilish/
  ‚û° Kubebuilder Crash Course: https://youtu.be/azJsyLjvHsI

  (0:00) Intro
  (01:31) What is Model Context Protocol?
  (04:04) MCP Architecture & Core Primitives
  (04:40) Resources, Tools, and Prompts
  (09:03) Building Your First MCP Server
  (14:40) Stdio vs HTTP Transport
  (19:45) Kubernetes Integration
  (57:10) MCP Server Operator Design
  (58:40) Creating the Operator with Kubebuilder
  (01:01:40) Custom Resource Definition
  (01:05:16) Reconcile Loop Implementation
  (01:13:18) Deploy and Test the Operatorx
  (01:17:23) Outro

  By the end of this tutorial, you'll have:
  ‚úÖ Built MCP servers that integrate LLMs with Kubernetes
  ‚úÖ Created a complete operator for managing MCP server deployments
  ‚úÖ Understood production considerations for AI infrastructure

  This tutorial bridges the gap between AI tooling and cloud-native infrastructure!

videos.title: Extending Kubernetes API with CRDs - Part 2 - Hands on Lab
videos.description:
Welcome to Part 2 of our Kubernetes API Deep Dive series! In this hands-on lab, we dive into extending Kubernetes APIs using Custom Resource Definitions (CRDs). Follow along as we set up a development environment, initialize a Kubebuilder project, create and validate a CRD, and deploy a sample custom resource. This tutorial is perfect for those looking to customize Kubernetes for their specific needs.

#Kubernetes #KubernetesAPI #CRD #Kubebuilder #CloudNative #DevOps #KubernetesTutorial #TechTutorial

‚û° Presentation: https://aghilish.github.io/k8s-api/  
‚û° Killercoda Lab: https://killercoda.com/aghilish/scenario/extending_k8s  
‚û° Part 1 - Introduction to Kubernetes API: https://youtu.be/qKrIizrEjUs
‚û° Kubebuilder Crash Course: https://youtu.be/azJsyLjvHsI

**Timeline:**  
(0:00) Intro  
(0:51) Environment Setup  
(1:41) Initialize a Kubebuilder Project  
(02:51) Create a Custom Resource Definition  
(04:51) Define Spec and Status  
(06:18) Add Validation Markers  
(07:54) Generate and Install the CRD  
(11:04) Create a Sample Custom Resource  
(11:37) Run the Controller Locally  
(13:09) Cleanup  
(13:59) Further Resources  
(14:33) Outro

videos.title: Extending Kubernetes API with CRDs - Part 2 - Theory
videos.description:
Welcome to Part 2 of our Kubernetes API Deep Dive series! In this theory-focused session, we explore the concepts behind extending Kubernetes APIs using Custom Resource Definitions (CRDs). Join us as we break down API aggregation, Kubebuilder fundamentals, and the process of creating and validating CRDs. Learn about defining Spec and Status, using Marker Comments, leveraging Common Expression Language (CEL) for validation, and configuring Additional Printer Columns. This tutorial is ideal for anyone looking to understand the theoretical foundations of customizing Kubernetes.

#Kubernetes #KubernetesAPI #CRD #Kubebuilder #CloudNative #DevOps #KubernetesTutorial #TechTutorial

‚û° Presentation: https://aghilish.github.io/k8s-api/  
‚û° Hands-On Lab: https://killercoda.com/aghilish/scenario/crds_kubebuilder
‚û° Part 1 - Introduction to Kubernetes API: https://youtu.be/qKrIizrEjUs  
‚û° Kubebuilder Crash Course: https://youtu.be/azJsyLjvHsI  

**Timeline:**  
(0:00) Intro  
(1:15) Extending the Kubernetes API  
(2:05) API Aggregation  
(3:43) Kubebuilder Overview  
(4:24) Creating Your API  
(4:50) Marker Comments  
(6:20) Defining Spec and Status in a CRD  
(11:44) Installing the CRD  
(12:54) Common Expression Language (CEL)  
(15:16) Additional Printer Columns  
(15:34) Final Remarks  
(16:25) Outro

videos.title: Introduction to Kubernetes API: Architecture, Interaction, and Object Model - Part 1
videos.description:
Welcome to the Kubernetes API Deep Dive presentation! In this video, we will explore the architecture of the Kubernetes API, how to interact with it, and the Kubernetes object model. This presentation is designed to help you understand the core mechanisms of the Kubernetes API and how to effectively manage and interact with a Kubernetes cluster.


#Kubernetes #KubernetesAPI #CloudNative #DevOps #KubernetesTutorial  #KubernetesControllers #KubernetesLearning  #TechTutorial 


‚û°  Presentation: https://aghilish.github.io/k8s-api/

‚û°  Extending Kubernetes with Kubebuilder: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=azJsyLjvHsI

videos.title: From K8SGPT to Schednex ‚Äì  Introducing AI-Powered ü§ñ Kubernetes Control Planes! üöÄ
videos.description:
Discover how K8SGPT uses AI to diagnose Kubernetes cluster issues, and how Schednex takes it further by making smart pod placement decisions. Schednex leverages K8SGPT insights to optimize scheduling, ensuring efficient workload distribution ‚Äì and defaults to the standard scheduler when needed.



#kubernetes  #crashcourse #llm #ai #languagemodels #controlplane
#cloudnative #programming #CloudNative #Tutorial #sre #openai #openaichatgpt 

‚û°  Killercoda Lab: https://killercoda.com/aghilish/scenario/k8sgpt
‚û°  K8SGPT: https://github.com/k8sgpt-ai/k8sgpt
‚û°  K8SGPT Operator: https://github.com/k8sgpt-ai/k8sgpt-operator
‚û°  Schednex: https://github.com/schednex-ai/schednex
‚û°  Schednex Demo from Alex Jones @CloudNativeSkunkworks : https://youtu.be/IiM_n-JwgaI?

videos.title: Kubernetes The Hard Way by Kelsey Hightower | Build Your Own Cluster From Scratch!
videos.description:
"Kubernetes the Hard Way" by Kelsey Hightower is one of the best tutorials available for gaining a comprehensive, bird‚Äôs-eye view of Kubernetes architecture. By following this guide, you‚Äôll gain a deep understanding of how Kubernetes components are seamlessly integrated. To further enhance the learning experience, I‚Äôve added additional documentation covering Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) and container networking, offering more insight into these crucial topics.




#kubernetes  #crashcourse #platformengineering 
#cloudnative #programming ##DevOps #CloudNative #Tutorial

‚û°  GitHub: https://github.com/aghilish/kubernetes-the-hard-way/tree/youtube-tutorial

videos.title: Where is my webhook running? Kubebuilder crash course #cloudnative #kubebuilder #kubernetes
Testing Validating Webhooks - Kubebuilder Crash Course #kubebuilder #cloudnative #kubernetes
Kubernetes Admission Webhooks - Kubebuilder Tutorial
videos.description:
Admission webhooks are powerful tools in Kubernetes that allow you to intercept and modify requests to the Kubernetes API server. They enable dynamic admission control, allowing you to enforce custom policies and ensure compliance with organizational standards. In this video, we will cover everything you need to know to create, deploy, and test your own admission webhooks.


#kubernetes  #crashcourse #kubebuilder #platformengineering 
#cloudnative #programming #AdmissionWebhooks #Kubebuilder #K8s #DevOps #CloudNative #Tutorial

‚û°  Hands-on Lab:  https://killercoda.com/aghilish/scenario/webhooks
‚û°  Playbook: https://roozy-io.github.io/idp/tutorials/k8s-webhooks.html
‚û°  GitHub: https://github.com/aghilish/operator-tutorial/tree/feat/webhook
‚û°  Kubebuilder Tutorial:  https://killercoda.com/aghilish/scenario/webhooks

Kubebuilder Crash Course - Extend Kubernetes Like a Pro!
videos.description:
Operator pattern is very popular for bringing domain knowledge into Kubernetes and extend the Kubernetes api. There are some good tooling built by the Kubernetes community that makes building an operator much easier and https://kubebuilder.io is one of the most popular ones.

#cloudnative #programming

videos.title: Crossplane Composition Functions Deep Dive
videos.description:
Crossplane composition functions allows platform engineers to extend the crossplane core and implement custom logic for their compositions.

The source of the requests is ùóñùóøùóºùòÄùòÄùóΩùóπùóÆùóªùó≤ ùóñùóºùóøùó≤ ùó•ùòÇùóªùòÅùó∂ùó∫ùó≤.

videos.title: Crossplane Compositions vs Terraform Modules
videos.description:
Crossplane is an advanced tool for managing infrastructure in the cloud-native ecosystem. Crossplane API allows platform engineers to group managed resources into compositions and hide the complexities from application teams. 

#crossplane #iac #kubernetes #platformengineering 
#terraform #cloudnative
‚û°  Gist with the commands: https://roozy-io.github.io/idp/templating/crossplane-compositions.html
‚û°  GitHub: https://github.com/aghilish/crossplane-compositions-vs-terraform-modules

(2:18) Compositions architecture
(4:36) Sample GKE cluster module in Terraform 
(5:55) Setup Crossplane
(9:17) Apply XRD
(12:00) Apply Composition
(13:06) Composition Functions
